newsitem.title: UK: Bell Cablemedia Plc nine month loss widens.
newsitem.headline: Bell Cablemedia Plc nine month loss widens.

text.p: NOTE - Share figures are per American Depositary Shares, with one ADS representing five ordinary shares.
The company attributed the increased loss to increases in depreciation and amortisation and net interest expenses. Year-ago results included a dilution gain of 9.0 million stg.
The UK cable and telephony firm said its Q3 total revenues rose 59 percent to 18.0 million stg from the year-ago period.

Residential telephony penetration rose to 19.9 percent from 19.1 percent compared to the year-earlier quarter, while cable television penetration was up at 18.6 percent from 18.0 percent. Annual cable television churn rose by 2.0 percentage points to an 24.5 percent at Sept 30 versus the second quarter of 1996, and annual residential telephony churn added 1.7 percentage points to 18.0 percent.
The company attributed the rise to an audit resulting in the disconnection of customers who had not paid for 90 days or more.

Cable and Wireless Plc, NYNEX Corp and Bell Canada International said last month they would merge the operations of their UK subsidiaries, Mercury Communications, NYNEX CableComms and Bell Cablemedia.
In a related deal, Bell Cablemedia offered to buy Videotron Holdings Plc from Le Groupe Videotron in a deal valuing the British cable company at about $1.09 billion.
